issue.description: We need to be able to relate type to actual (and the other way round). e.g. John Smith (person) is a grade 3 welder (type) with 5 years experience (actual). A grade 3 welder must have at least 3 years experience

comment.description:
During the modelling, the discussion on this topic went something like this ..
John Smith is a grade 3 welder - grade 3 welder is a qualification. If you want to assign John Smith to a welding task, you would check that he has the qualification to do the task (i.e. he is grade 3 welder).
Grade 3 welder must have at least 3 years experience - grade 3 welder is a type_of_person. A definition of this type of person is that he could have 3 years experience. Another definition could be that he has been to the "university of welding" and has 1 year experience. In the task analysis, you would assign a grade 3 welder as a type_of_person to do a task.
The idea of John Smith being classed as a type_of_person was not discussed. No reason why not, but I guess that this would be done at a higher level module.
